results.title: The Animals are crying
results.creator_credit: Peter Beltz, Paul Martin Smith and PMS Films
results.brief_description: This film shows how pet owners fail to understand the responsibility of raising animals by telling about the garbage men who almost discard a box until they realise there are live kittens in it. Also suggests owners spay their female cats. (Short version). Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: [Roadblocks to communication]
results.creator_credit: Russell Morash, Boston University and WGBH (Boston)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Dynamics of leadership”.
The problem of communication in group discussions and lecture presentations. Sometimes ideas which are perfectly clear to the speaker are misconstrued by the listener. Examines how this can lead to misunderstandings.

results.title: Sharing the Leadership
results.creator_credit: Russell Morash and National Educational Television
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Dynamics of leadership”.
Explores three categories of individual action and their relation to group leadership: self-serving functions, task functions and group serving functions.

results.title: The Anatomy of a group
results.creator_credit: Russell Morash, Boston University and WGBH (Boston)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Dynamics of leadership”.
Illustrates the structure of a group, the goals to be achieved during meetings, participation patterns, the quality of communication, group standards, and group procedures. Discusses the difference between a collection of individuals and a group, and the means of getting a new group off to a good start.

results.title: Diagnosing group operations
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Dynamics of leadership”.
Uses demonstrations and discussion to consider the causes of problems that arise in groups: signs of conflict, withdrawal, factionalism, and group indecision, along with their crippling effect on the life of the group. Explains how to identify symptoms of group problems.

results.title: [Individual motivation and behavior]
results.creator_credit: Russell Morasi, Boston University and WGBH (Boston)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Dynamics of leadership”.
Deals with individual motivation and behaviour in groups, explaining why people join groups and why some members block or dominate group action. Presents a demonstration and discusses the motivation of each participant in the demonstration.

results.title: The Animal movie
results.creator_credit: Grant Munro, Ron Tunis, Sidney Goldsmith and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: An animated cartoon to help children explore why and how animals move as they do. A little boy discovers that he cannot compete with animals - monkey, snake, horse etc - by imitating the way they move. He only outdistances them when he climbs into a vehicle that can travel in any environment - proving that, while other animals are trapped by their environment, man, the inventor, isn’t. An award winning film.

results.title: The Agony of Jimmy Quinlan
results.creator_credit: Andy Thomson, Janice H Brown, Robert Duncan, Peter Katadotis and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Jimmy Quinlan is a derelict, one of some five thousand other men and women who have abandoned their jobs and families to live in the streets and alleys in Montreal. This film, a powerful portrayal of life on skid row, tells of his “agonies” - his attempt to get off the bottle. It’s something he’s tried before, and will probably have to try again. Award: New York
results.creator_credit_for_label: Andy Thomson, Janice H Brown, Robert Duncan, Peter Katadotis and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: The Ageing of the lakes
results.creator_credit: John Walker and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Explains the process of the natural ageing and eventual death of lakes, called eutrophication. Also links man’s environmental interference with the changes in the lakes and investigates current efforts to retard eutrophication and preserve and restore lakes in America. Discusses pollution and methods for its control.
